description: '''Shana Beth Halligan''' (born October 11, 1973) is a singer, songwriter, and composer based in [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], best known for her work as the former vocalist for the [[trip-hop]] act [[Bitter:Sweet]]. She is the daughter of [[Dick Halligan]], a founding member of the American rock band [[Blood, Sweat & Tears]].  In 2018, she appeared as a contestant in [[The Voice (U.S. season 14)|season 14]] of the American series ''[[The Voice (U.S. TV series)|The Voice]]''.
